oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Oral history interview with Mildred Owsley Buchanan, 1980 November, excerpt 02
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: An excerpt from an oral history interview with Nashville educator Mildred Owsley Buchanan., conducted on two dates in November 1980 by Paul Clements as part of the Century III Nashville: Nashville Heritage Project. Buchanan, a home economics teacher in Nashville city schools from the late 1920s through ca. 1963, discusses education during the early 1900s. She describes the interior of Corley School on Lebanon Road, which she attended for grades 1 through 7 from 1909 to 1914. The complete interview is available in the repository.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Buchanan, Mildred Owsley, 1902-2000--Interviews
Corley Elementary School (Nashville, Tenn.)
